meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a mantra.
meanings.sent1: The mantric chants filled the room with a sense of peace.
meanings.sent2: Her voice had a mantric quality that was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent3: The mantric melody played on repeat in his mind, making him feel calm.
meanings.sent4: The mantric rhythm of the song echoed through the halls, enchanting all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The mantric words seemed to wrap around her like a warm blanket, bringing comfort.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a mantra.
meanings.sent1: The mantric symbols on the wall seemed to hold a mystical power.
meanings.sent2: His movements were slow and deliberate, almost mantric in nature.
meanings.sent3: The mantric patterns on the fabric seemed to dance before her eyes.
meanings.sent4: The mantric energy in the room was palpable, filling the air with a sense of serenity.
meanings.sent5: The mantric aura around him seemed to glow with an inner light, captivating all who saw.

meanings.definition: Used in or related to the practice of chanting mantras.
meanings.sent1: The mantric incense wafted through the air, enhancing the meditation experience.
meanings.sent2: Her mantric gestures added a sense of reverence to the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The mantric atmosphere in the temple was thick with devotion and peace.
meanings.sent4: The mantric sounds of the chanting monks reverberated through the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The mantric rituals performed at dawn brought a sense of harmony to the day.
